content: The traditional way of life of the Inuit people in the Arctic is characterized by hunting and fishing for subsistence, using igloos or snow houses as temporary shelter, and traveling by dog sleds or kayaks. The Inuit have a deep connection to their environment and are skilled at using resources from the land and sea for survival. They also have a rich and vibrant culture that includes storytelling, music, and intricate artwork. Family and community are central to Inuit life, and cooperation and sharing are essential for survival in the harsh Arctic environment.
